misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that the text inside a System.out.print statement serves as a template that the Scanner automatically understands. By printing '(x1, y1):', the student expects the Scanner to skip the decorative parentheses and comma and extract only the numeric values from a user's input that follows that visual format.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no semantic link between the output stream (System.out) and the input stream (Scanner). The Scanner does not 'read' the prompt and cannot automatically parse formatted strings like '(x, y)' using only nextDouble(). If a user inputs the coordinates with parentheses as suggested by the prompt, the program will throw an InputMismatchException.
